question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Let $P(x)$ be the degree three polynomial with
\begin{align*}
P(1) &= \log 1, \\
P(2) &= \log 2, \\
P(3) &= \log 3, \\
P(4) &= \log 4.
\end{align*}Then $P(5)$ can be expressed in the form $A \log \frac{B}{C},$ where $A,$ $B,$ and $C$ are positive integers, and $C$ is prime.  Find $A + B + C.$
inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{11}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Let the cubic polynomial be $P(x) = ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d.$   Then
\begin{align*}
a + b + c + d &= P(1), \\
8a + 4b + 2c + d &= P(2), \\
27a + 9b + 3c + d &= P(3), \\
64a + 16b + 4c + d &= P(4), \\
125a + 25b + 5c + d &= P(5).
\end{align*}Subtracting the first and second equations, second and third equations, and third and fourth equations, we get
\begin{align*}
7a + 3b + c &= P(2) - P(1), \\
19a + 5b + c &= P(3) - P(2), \\
37a + 7b + c &= P(4) - P(3), \\
61a + 9b + c &= P(5) - P(4).
\end{align*}Again subtracting the equations in pairs, we get
\begin{align*}
12a + 2b &= P(3) - 2P(2) + P(1), \\
18a + 2b &= P(4) - 2P(3) + P(2), \\
24a + 2b &= P(5) - 2P(4) + P(3).
\end{align*}Then
\begin{align*}
6a &= P(4) - 3P(3) + 3P(2) - P(1), \\
6a &= P(5) - 3P(4) + 3P(3) - P(2),
\end{align*}so $P(5) - 3P(4) + 3P(3) - P(2) = P(4) - 3P(3) + 3P(2) - P(1).$

Hence,
\begin{align*}
P(5) &= 4P(4) - 6P(3) + 4P(2) - P(1) \\
&= 4 \log 4 - 6 \log 3 + 4 \log 2 - \log 1 \\
&= 4 \log 2^2 - 6 \log 3 + 4 \log 2 \\
&= 8 \log 2 - 6 \log 3 + 4 \log 2 \\
&= 12 \log 2 - 6 \log 3 \\
&= 6 \log 4 - 6 \log 3 \\
&= 6 \log \frac{4}{3}.
\end{align*}Therefore, $A + B + C = 6 + 4 + 3 = \boxed{13}.$

ground_truth:
Let the cubic polynomial be $P(x) = ax^3 + bx^2 + cx + d.$   Then
\begin{align*}
a + b + c + d &= P(1), \\
8a + 4b + 2c + d &= P(2), \\
27a + 9b + 3c + d &= P(3), \\
64a + 16b + 4c + d &= P(4), \\
125a + 25b + 5c + d &= P(5).
\end{align*}Subtracting the first and second equations, second and third equations, and third and fourth equations, we get
\begin{align*}
7a + 3b + c &= P(2) - P(1), \\
19a + 5b + c &= P(3) - P(2), \\
37a + 7b + c &= P(4) - P(3), \\
61a + 9b + c &= P(5) - P(4).
\end{align*}Again subtracting the equations in pairs, we get
\begin{align*}
12a + 2b &= P(3) - 2P(2) + P(1), \\
18a + 2b &= P(4) - 2P(3) + P(2), \\
24a + 2b &= P(5) - 2P(4) + P(3).
\end{align*}Then
\begin{align*}
6a &= P(4) - 3P(3) + 3P(2) - P(1), \\
6a &= P(5) - 3P(4) + 3P(3) - P(2),
\end{align*}so $P(5) - 3P(4) + 3P(3) - P(2) = P(4) - 3P(3) + 3P(2) - P(1).$

Hence,
\begin{align*}
P(5) &= 4P(4) - 6P(3) + 4P(2) - P(1) \\
&= 4 \log 4 - 6 \log 3 + 4 \log 2 - \log 1 \\
&= 4 \log 2^2 - 6 \log 3 + 4 \log 2 \\
&= 8 \log 2 - 6 \log 3 + 4 \log 2 \\
&= 12 \log 2 - 6 \log 3 \\
&= 6 \log 4 - 6 \log 3 \\
&= 6 \log \frac{4}{3}.
\end{align*}Therefore, $A + B + C = 6 + 4 + 3 = \boxed{13}.$
